questions.text: Original: 'The company's profits have been declining steadily over the past three years.'
options: The company has been making more money each year for three years.
The company's profits have been consistently decreasing for three years.
The company started losing money three years ago.
The company's profits increased steadily in the last three years.
questions.explanation: התשובה הנכונה היא משפט 2. 'declining steadily' זהה במשמעות ל-'consistently decreasing' - שניהם מתארים ירידה מתמשכת ועקבית ברווחים. 'over the past three years' זהה ל-'for three years'. דוגמה דומה: 'Sales are dropping continuously' = 'Sales are consistently decreasing'.
questions.grammarRule: Present Perfect Continuous with time expressions: have been + -ing + time period

questions.text: Original: 'It is essential that all employees attend the safety training session.'
options: All employees should consider attending the safety training session.
It would be nice if all employees attended the safety training session.
All employees must attend the safety training session.
All employees are invited to attend the safety training session.
questions.explanation: התשובה הנכונה היא משפט 3. 'It is essential that' מבטא חובה מוחלטת, זהה ל-'must'. שני הביטויים מדגישים שההשתתפות היא הכרחית ולא רשות. האפשרויות האחרות מבטאות המלצה או הזמנה, לא חובה. דוגמה דומה: 'It is crucial that you arrive on time' = 'You must arrive on time'.
questions.grammarRule: Formal necessity: It is essential/crucial that + subject + base verb = must

questions.text: Original: 'The weather was so terrible that we decided to cancel our picnic.'
options: We cancelled our picnic because the weather was extremely bad.
Despite the terrible weather, we went on our picnic.
The weather was nice, so we decided to have a picnic.
We had our picnic even though the weather was terrible.
questions.explanation: התשובה הנכונה היא משפט 1. 'so terrible that' מבטא סיבה ותוצאה, זהה ל-'because... extremely bad'. שני המשפטים מסבירים שמזג האוויר הרע היה הסיבה לביטול הפיקניק. המבנה 'so...that' מציג תוצאה, ו-'because' מציג סיבה. דוגמה דומה: 'It was so cold that we stayed inside' = 'We stayed inside because it was extremely cold'.
questions.grammarRule: Cause and effect: so + adjective + that = because + extremely + adjective

questions.text: Original: 'She rarely goes to the cinema these days.'
options: She goes to the cinema very often nowadays.
She never went to the cinema in the past.
She doesn't go to the cinema very often anymore.
She always goes to the cinema these days.
questions.explanation: התשובה הנכונה היא משפט 3. 'rarely' פירושו כמעט לא, זהה ל-'doesn't... very often'. 'these days' ו-'anymore' מתייחסים לתקופה הנוכחית. המשפט מתאר שינוי בהרגלים - בעבר הלכה יותר, כיום פחות. דוגמה דומה: 'He rarely calls me' = 'He doesn't call me very often'.
questions.grammarRule: Frequency adverbs: rarely = not very often, seldom = hardly ever

questions.text: Original: 'Unless you study harder, you won't pass the exam.'
options: If you study harder, you won't pass the exam.
You will pass the exam even if you don't study harder.
If you don't study harder, you won't pass the exam.
You will definitely pass the exam regardless of your studying.
questions.explanation: התשובה הנכונה היא משפט 3. 'Unless' פירושו 'אם לא', זהה ל-'if... don't'. שני המשפטים מציגים תנאי שלילי - אם לא תלמד יותר, לא תעבור. 'Unless' הוא דרך קצרה לומר 'if not'. התוצאה זהה בשני המקרים. דוגמה דומה: 'Unless it rains, we'll go out' = 'If it doesn't rain, we'll go out'.
questions.grammarRule: Conditional sentences: Unless + positive = If + negative (same meaning)
